plants.name: Lilium candidum
plants.description: A striking perennial bulbous plant known for its large, fragrant white flowers that symbolize purity. It thrives in Mediterranean climates and is often found in gardens and wild settings.
plants.funFact: Madonna Lily has been cultivated since ancient times and was considered sacred in many cultures, often associated with the Virgin Mary.

plants.name: Magnolia grandiflora
plants.description: An evergreen tree famous for its large, creamy white, highly fragrant flowers and glossy leaves. It blooms abundantly in spring and can continue sporadically into summer.
plants.funFact: Magnolia flowers are an ancient lineage predating bees; they were originally pollinated by beetles, making them some of the oldest flowering plants.

plants.name: Rhododendron ponticum
plants.description: An evergreen shrub that produces clusters of bell-shaped flowers, commonly found in woodlands and heathlands. It flourishes in temperate zones during spring.
plants.funFact: In some regions, Rhododendron ponticum is considered invasive, spreading aggressively and outcompeting native flora.

plants.name: Erythrina crista-galli
plants.description: A small tree or shrub with vibrant, spiky red flowers that attract hummingbirds and butterflies. It blooms in late spring, adding brilliant color to subtropical landscapes.
plants.location: South America, particularly Argentina and Uruguay
plants.funFact: Cockspur Coral Tree is the national flower of Argentina and Uruguay, symbolizing strength and resilience.
